intro: Laserpitium siler subsp. siculum, commonly known as Sicilian siler, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Mediterranean region, particularly Sicily, and thrives in rocky or dry soils. Due to its ornamental value and historical use in traditional medicine, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
